review: In my experience for a month, this has been excellent.  At $30 to $35, this thing is too good and too cheap to not have.  Its simple and does only one thing:  it enables Chrome apps to transmit a tab or video to a HDMI-equipped TV.  I've run YouTube, Netflix, and broadcasting Chrome tabs to the TV without problems.  ChromeCast works from Chrome browsers on Mac, Windows, and iOS tablets and phones.  (It works from Android of course, but I didn't have an Android device to test it personally.)  Video quality is similar to a good smartphone, but seems to have a lower resolution and color depth than an AppleTV.  Frame rate for video is smooth, but video is slightly solarized (/looks like/ 65535 (16-bit) color where the Apple TV looks like 16 million (24-bit) color).It's great.  It's $30 to $35.  Buy it.
